not tracked not covered covered 
package datumhash

import (
        "bytes"
        "crypto/sha256"
        "encoding/binary"
        "hash"
        "sort"
        "unicode/utf16"

        "github.com/signalfuse/sfxinternalgo/sbingest/datum"
        "github.com/signalfx/golib/datapoint"
)

// DatapointHash is anything that can create a unique one way hash of a datapoint
type DatapointHash interface {
        Sum(into *bytes.Buffer, dp *datapoint.Datapoint)
}

// DatumHash is anything that can create a unique one way hash of a datum
type DatumHash interface {
        Sum(into *bytes.Buffer, dp *datum.Datum)
}

// SHA256Hasher uses sha256 to hash a datapoint the same way we do in Java
type SHA256Hasher struct {
        encoder  goJavaStringEncoder
        hasher   hash.Hash
        allKeys  []string
        tmpBytes [sha256.Size]byte
}

// SHA256DatumHasher uses SHA256Hasher to hash datum
type SHA256DatumHasher struct {
        hasher   SHA256Hasher
        tmpBytes [8]byte
}

// InitDatumHasher creates a SHA256DatumHasher hasher
func InitDatumHasher() SHA256DatumHasher {
        return SHA256DatumHasher{
                hasher: InitSHA256Hasher(),
        }
}

// Sum hashes a datum into the given buffer
func (s *SHA256DatumHasher) Sum(into *bytes.Buffer, dp *datum.Datum) {
        binary.BigEndian.PutUint64(s.tmpBytes[:], uint64(dp.OrgID))
        into.Write(s.tmpBytes[0:8])
        s.hasher.HashInto(into, dp.Datapoint)
}

// InitSHA256Hasher creates a datapoint hasher
func InitSHA256Hasher() SHA256Hasher {
        return SHA256Hasher{
                hasher:  sha256.New(),
                allKeys: make([]string, 16),
                encoder: goJavaStringEncoder{
                        runes: make([]rune, 128),
                        bytes: make([]byte, 256),
                },
        }
}

// goJavaStringEncoder will hash a go string as a Java utf16 string, while keeping tmp copies of
// buffer memory so we don't constantly realloc
type goJavaStringEncoder struct {
        runes []rune
        bytes []byte
}

// Encode a string as utf16 in bytes.  Not thread safe!
func (g *goJavaStringEncoder) Encode(s string) []byte {
        g.runes = g.runes[:0]
        for _, r := range s {
                g.runes = append(g.runes, r)
        }
        unicodeSequence := utf16.Encode(g.runes)
        neededReturnSize := len(unicodeSequence) * 2
        if len(g.bytes) < neededReturnSize {
                g.bytes = make([]byte, neededReturnSize)
        }
        at := 0
        for _, u := range unicodeSequence {
                binary.LittleEndian.PutUint16(g.bytes[at:at+2], u)
                at += 2
        }
        return g.bytes[0:neededReturnSize]
}

func (s *SHA256Hasher) sortedDimensions(dp *datapoint.Datapoint) []string {
        sliceSize := len(dp.Dimensions) + 1
        if len(s.allKeys) < sliceSize {
                s.allKeys = make([]string, sliceSize)
        }
        ret := s.allKeys[0:sliceSize]
        ret[0] = "sf_metric"
        idx := 1
        for k := range dp.Dimensions {
                ret[idx] = k
                idx++
        }
        sort.Strings(ret)
        return ret
}

// HashInto will hash a datapoint into buf
func (s *SHA256Hasher) HashInto(buf *bytes.Buffer, dp *datapoint.Datapoint) {
        s.hasher.Reset()
        allKeys := s.sortedDimensions(dp)
        for _, k := range allKeys {
                s.hasher.Write(s.encoder.Encode(k))
                if k == "sf_metric" {
                        s.hasher.Write(s.encoder.Encode(dp.Metric))
                } else {
                        s.hasher.Write(s.encoder.Encode(dp.Dimensions[k]))
                }
        }
        buf.Write(s.hasher.Sum(s.tmpBytes[:0]))
}
